isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 2000, 4000, 8000 - ELECTRONIC ENGINES, CUMMINS M11E AND N14E - OPERATION - ATA DATA LINK CONNECTOR (313)

svcproc.title: ATA DATA LINK CONNECTOR (313)
svcproc.para: The 6-pin ATA data link connector (313) allows an Electronic Service Tool (EST) to communicate with the ECM. The data link carries serial data transmissions between the ECM and the electronic service tool and provides vehicle and engine speed information to the speedometer/tachometer unit. The data link provides communication capabilities for:
Data Link connector (313) is located on the left instrument panel. Four of the six connector cavities have terminals.

para.emph: The positive and negative data link circuits are twisted wire pairs. The twisted wires serve to shield the wires form interference.

svcproc.para: The 6-pin diagnostic connector utilizes the four circuits as follows:

item.para: Terminal A, circuit 98A(+), is the positive Data Link connection to (355) Positive Data Link connector. (355) connector is Red. (355) data link connector is connected by circuit 98(+) to ECM connector (320) at terminal 27. (355) connector is also connected by circuit 47/48(+) to the speedometer and tachometer through the instrument cluster connector (27).

Terminal B, circuit 98C(-) connects Data Link connector (313) to (356) Negative Data Link connector. Connector (356) is Blue. Circuit 98B(-) connects connector (356) to ECM connector (320) terminal 8. Connector (356) is also connected by circuit 47/48(-) through connector (27) to the speedometer and tachometer in the instrument cluster.
The positive and negative data link circuits are a twisted wire pair. Twisting the wires shields the wires from interference.
Terminal C, circuit 97DB/97DL, is 12V ignition feed from F5 (10 AMP) fuse. Power is available with the key switch in the on position to power the electronic service tool.
Terminal E, circuit 11-GL, is grounded at G2 cab ground, providing a ground for the electronic service tool.
